title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 21
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: And, shutting the door hurriedly, he disappeared. About an hourafterwards, a tall female figure, coming up the entry from NorthRichmond Street, made a full stop, at about three yards from Abram'sdoor, and then darted off, but not before one of the guard had seenenough, as he thought, to enable him to swear that it was Slabberdash'scompanion, a woman known by the slang name of Four-toed Mary, once oneof the most dashing and beautiful of the local street-sirens. About anhour after that the two guards forgathered to compare notes.
